content: simple garter rib socks the simple garter rib socks are top- down socks that feature either a 1x7 or a 1x3 garter rib the rib extends down the heel flap resulting in a cute and stylish design and a comfortable well-fitting sock designed by belinda glynn simple garter rib socks finished size 17 5 20 22 5 cm / 7 7 75 8 75 inches circumference yarn 1 skein 4ply/fingering weight yarn note for very large sizes more than one skein of yarn may be required examples shown version 1 the seventh girl becky in miss erstwhile version 2 glenheaven knits high twist titanium sock yarn in derwent needles 2 25mm us 1 60 cm 24 inch circular needle or preferred sock-knitting needle notions tapestry needle stitch marker optional gauge 8 stitches x 11 5 row over 2 5cm 1 inch in stockinette abbreviations bor beginning of round k knit p purl sl1 slip 1 purlwise ssk slip 2 stitches knitwise knit these two stitches together through the back loop k2tog knit 2 stitches together p2tog purl 2 stitches together page 1 simple garter rib socks version 1 1 x 7 rib cuff and leg cast on 56 64 72 stitches using a stretchy cast-on such as the german twisted cast-on join being careful not to twist note this sock is written to be knitted using magic loop and therefore does not need a stitch marker to mark the bor however if using another method to knit the socks that does require a bor marker add a stitch marker here ribbing round *k1 p1* repeat to end of round repeat ribbing round 9 14 19 times there will be 10 15 20 ribbing rounds in total start garter rib pattern version 1 garter rib pattern version 1 row 1 knit all stitches row 2 k1 3 1 *p1 k7* repeat from * to * 5 6 7 times p1 k6 4 6 knit leg in garter rib pattern for 10 15 20 centimetres from the cast-on edge or desired leg length finishing with row 1 heel these heel directions have been written for magic loop with 28 32 36 stitches on each needle needle 1 contains the stitches for the top of the foot while needle 2 contains the heel and foot stitches heel flap heel flap set-up row on both needle 1 and needle 2 knit row 2 turn knitting on needle 2 sl1 purl to end of row the rest of the heel turn will be knit flat on the stitches on needle 2 heel flap row 1 sl1 k4 2 4 *p1 k7 * repeat from * to * 1 2 2 times p1 k6 4 6 heel flap row 2 sl1 purl to end of row repeat heel flap row 1 and 2 12 14 16 more times 28 32 36 heel flap row have been worked in total note if the person these socks are for has a high arch and needs extra fabric across
